If those that were so gung-ho pro-life actually CARED about the life they are rallying to see grown to term, I might not be so bitter.
 
 But the majority of those that whine and complain and denounce pro-choice movements as evil and barbaric and cruel to the wittle babies rarely stick around to help the mothers care for their newly liberated spawn. It seems to me that once the baby is born, the pro-life considers their job down and it's off to save the next expectant teenage mother from making a horrible mistake and adding a few more chips to the "Hell" side of the scale. Afterall, pro-lifers don't just save unwanted bundles of human genetic matieral with no memories, interests, bonds, personalities, etc... literally everything that distinguishes us from people in severre vegetative states.... why no! They also are saving souls!
 
 Except, what about fetus A, now baby A, who is wasting away in his teenage mother's crack hotel and abandoned in his play pen 18 hours a day because mommy is out hustling? I don't see these same pro-life groups rallying to protect and enrich the lives of the newly born, especially when the newly born in this scenario are those that exist solely as the result of "peer pressure" and the "mother" in question doesn't want the child to begin with....
 
 Knowing that, why aren't more pro-life groups interested in the fate of these unborn children once they are born? Too old? They lose that mystic caul or feathery dusting of snow-white lanugo, and what, they lose their charm?
 
 :xbanghead ALERT! The born who aren't wanted need just as much help, if not more, than the unborn that aren't wanted. These babies need to be rocked, held, cooed to, form early attachments, learn to feel loved...
 
 But wait, that's the mother's responsibility, right? So how come when it was the mother's responsibility to decide her own fate, so many pro-lifers decide they must interfere, but afterwards most of them seem more than content to let week old junior sink or swim of his own accord?
 
 If pro-lifers really cared about life and the QUALITY of life they were advocating I might have more respect for the general movement. And I am sure there are a few select individuals that do get involved and foster or adopt the unwanted children they helped bring into the world. But not enough do this, as indicated by ever growing rates of child abuse, neglect and abandonment.
 
 Tell me something, die hard pro-lifers. emoticon_xdonno Is it really more kind to bring a child into the world so that it can die of thirst in its crib a week before it's first birthday, as opposed to being terminated in the first month, before the basic pain receptors were even fully functioning?
 
 You tell me.
 
 AAW

I can give you two reasons why pro-life groups don't do things that you suggest in your post.
 
 1. Because they may have children of their own they're providing for since they are pro-life,
 
 2. Because of this.
 
 PRO-LIFER "It is now our job to nurture and take care of those children who won't have a good future because of their parents or resources.
 
 DESPERATE MAN "Honey! Let's go ahead and dump all our kids on these people because they want to raise our children so we won't have to! Let's tell the whole neighboorhood or even the whole city! Mr. Pro-lifer is going to care for them all now!
 
 --
 
 I doubt pro-abortionists would (or do) the same for their cause either anyway.
 
 Besides, you brought up some of the ultimate death scenarios for children you could possibly think of. How many children in the U.S. die of thirst daily? Like........... 0. Besides that, any person with a baby they can't provide for can give it up for adoption. There aren't enough babies to go around in this country, there are plenty of bright possibilities for them there.
 
 And I'll tell you why. Disregarding the unusual circumstance you had in your scenario, you're trying to play God and decide the better fate for someone else. I may as well try and kill my family since I doubt any of them will be able to provide for themselves in the near future. It is not an honorable thing to do, nor is it their place. A couple has sex, they live with it. Having an abortion is not taking responsibility. It is playing the part of the executioner with good intentions. There is none.

I hate when generalizations are made like this. I hate that you (and many others) use some conservative fundamentalists as an example of all people who are pro-life. I too, as someone who is pro-life, think it is absurd, inconsistent, and morally irresponsible for someone to be both pro-life and unsupportive of services and support for children and young families. But to say that this represents all pro-lifers is at best ignorant and at worst a willfull lie.
 
 A tip for the future: when you say things like "wittle babies" and "spawn" you don't exactly appear the most compassionate yourself.

But you don't have any problem with forcing women to go through pregnancies that they do not want--forcing them to give birth to children they are unable to care for. Nice.

Besides that, any person with a baby they can't provide for can give it up for adoption. I may as well try and kill my family since I doubt any of them will be able to provide for themselves in the near future. It is not an honorable thing to do, nor is it their place. A couple has sex, they live with it. Having an abortion is not taking responsibility. It is playing the part of the executioner with good intentions. There is none.
It's not playing God to force women to give birth against their will?

But you don't have any problem with forcing women to go through pregnancies that they do not want--forcing them to give birth to children they are unable to care for. Nice.
 I don't mind forcing anyone to not kill someone else...no matter how much you don't want to take care of them or can't or whatever reason.
 
 
Lovely. I guess there aren't any children at all outside of the United States.
 Well abortion is a law thing and for the most part it seems like he was getting after the US (as he has done in other posts)...nevertheless, starving children are around even with abortion and there is no reason to believe abortion has "helped" this problem.
 
 
It's not playing God to force women to give birth against their will?
 No, you are forcing them to not force someone else to die....seems reasonable to me.
Anti-Abortionists want to deal with a "moral issue". Someone else's babies and children aren't involved with that issue. Simply a by-product.

Anti-Abortionists want to deal with a "moral issue". Someone else's babies and children aren't involved with that issue. Simply a by-product.

 
 How is abortion not a moral issue? Murder is a "moral" issue as well..same with theft...etc.

Let's clear up some things. Master Shake, I didn't say all Pro-Lifers didn't give a damn about born children (or non-Americans). I said most. And that, of course, is of the majority I have personally met, which you can not refute for the simple fact of being unnable to claim meeting the same people as I have.
 
 MOST.
 
 In short, if the parent doesn't want the unborn and you rally to keep it alive, you are in short the catalyst that brings that piece of tissue into the world and allows it to grow into a human being. It is your responsibility. Don't like that? Stop meddling in other people's affaris then.
 
 I use terms like "spawn" because they are accurate. I have found that many people on these boards don't seem to own dictionaries. :xbanghead There is nothing cruel or cold hearted about using scientific terms accurately. Here is the dictionary defintion of spawn *sighs*:
 
 entries found for spawn.
 spawn ( P ) Pronunciation Key (spôn)
 n. 
 The eggs of aquatic animals such as bivalve mollusks, fishes, and amphibians. 
 Offspring occurring in numbers; brood. 
 A person who is the issue of a parent or family. 
 The source of something; a germ or seed. 
 A product or an outcome. 
 Mycelia of mushrooms or other fungi grown in specially prepared organic matter for planting in beds. 
 
 v. spawned, spawn·ing, spawns 
 v. intr.
 To deposit eggs; produce spawn. 
 To produce offspring in large numbers. 
 
 v. tr.
 To produce or deposit (spawn). 
 To produce in large numbers. 
 To give rise to; engender: tyranny that spawned revolt. 
 To cause to spawn; bring forth; produce: a family that had spawned a monster. 
 To plant with mycelia grown in specially prepared organic matter. 
 
 ______________
 So you see, "spawn" is perfectly appropriate. It is even more appropriate in relation to the Dugger family.
 
 When I use terms like "wittle babies" I am trying to highlight the idiopcy of referring to first trimester embryos as "children" (most abortions are first trimester, after all, and no matter how many tragic third trimester partial abortion photos are posted doesn't change this fact).... first trimester embryos have about as much sensation and perception of pain as goldfish. By referring to them as wittle babies, I was trying to be ironic.
 
 At any rate, I think I have said it before, but I AM NOT MALE. I am FEMALE. That means I have two X chromosomes instead of an X and a Y, and because I have two X chromosomes I have slightly more genetic material which protects me from a lot of sex-related disorders (like hemophilia, which isn't exclusive to males but much more likely in males, ALD and countless other disorders).
 
 Be careful pointing fingers about lack of compassion. I am pro abortion. That does not mean I am not compassionate and to insinuate as much is disingenuous. I give blood every 56 days, am a volunteer to clean up natural biomes that have been destroyed by thoughtless humans, care for an abused cat that was going to be put to death (who is doing well, thanks), sponsor children overseas even though I am on disability and live on less than most people's car payments (after bills and rent), mentor at-risk youth and have allowed my body to be used be medical science in the search for a cervical cancer vaccine, which, while apparently harmless, could also have unexpected side effects (which is why I am called a human test subject). I don't get paid for any of the above. I do it because I want to make the world a better place. As far as I know, I dedicate about 80% of my waking hours, when I am not in college, working on philanthropic projects or projects to help non-human animals or the world. I wonder how much time the average pro-lifer gives to causes outside his immidiate church's urging, or those that aren't inspired by searching for cures (such as diabetes walks) because the pro-lifer in question has diabetes. I have met a lot of pro-lifers in my time who accuse me of lacking compassion, but when it comes to risking their health, safety and comfort to benefit someone else they have never met and probably never will meet, most, in MY experience, back out. Slap a pro-life sticker on the door, and go to bed feeling morally superior.
 
 So unless you're doing quite a bit more than me to relieve suffering and better the world, I'd be careful with the insinuations.
 
 Master Shake: I never said ALL pro-lifers behave as I earlier described. I said most, and, given that this is my personal opinion and not a scientific essay based on stats, those "most" reflect the pro-lifers I have met and gotten to know throughout my life. So don't take offense. If it doesn't apply to you, forget it.
 
 As for the person who commented that no children die of thirst in America. *laughs* Children die of neglect all the time, and one of the first things to kill a small child is lack of water.
 
 Besides that, I am not American. I tend to look at things a little more globally, instead of focusing on only "my" country. Countries are fictional. They do not exist in reality. Humans divide up the land and fight and wage wars, because we are territorial animals, but the actual divisions are fairly arbitrary. Maybe when you grow up, you'll realize that.
 
 Peace emoticon_xkill

And that, of course, is of the majority I have personally met, which you can not refute for the simple fact of being unnable to claim meeting the same people as I have.

In short, if the parent doesn't want the unborn and you rally to keep it alive, you are in short the catalyst that brings that piece of tissue into the world and allows it to grow into a human being. It is your responsibility. Don't like that? Stop meddling in other people's affaris then.

Besides that, I am not American. I tend to look at things a little more globally, instead of focusing on only "my" country. Countries are fictional. They do not exist in reality.
